Package Main.Scores

Class ScoreBoard

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Dialog
javax.swing.JDialog
Main.Scores.ScoreBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class ScoreBoard
extends javax.swing.JDialog
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
Public class ScoreBoard is responsible for showing the list of highscores for that level at the end of every level and also the highscores for the whole game at the end of the game. The player score, time and category are listed and the player is prompted to enter their name to save their achievement. A new object is created at the end of each level and at the end of the game.
Since:
28/11/2021
Version:
1.0
Author:
TanZhunXian
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • ScoreBoard

      public ScoreBoard​(javax.swing.JFrame owner, int level, int[][] scoreAndTime, int[][] choice) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This constructor is used to load and display highscores for each level after the level is completed and highscores for the whole game after the game is completed. It is called after every level and when the game ends. The highscore list is loaded into the linked list, then is resorted, renumbered and duplicates removed so that the rankings shown are accurate.
      Parameters:
      owner - JFrame used to center the ScoreBoard.
      level - Integer to get current level number.
      scoreAndTime - Double array of integers to record player time and score for each level and the whole game.
      choice - Double array of integers to get player choice to generate level category.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - This constructor throws FileNotFoundException when the highscore list for that level does not exist.

  • Method Details

    • Load

      private void Load​(java.util.LinkedList<Score> loadScore, int level) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This method is used to load the highscore lists into linked lists so that the top 10 highscores for each level and the total highscore for the game can be shown.
      Parameters:
      loadScore - The linked list where the highscore list is loaded into.
      level - This is the level for which the highscore list is loaded.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - This IOException is thrown if the highscore list does not exist.

    • Save

      private void Save​(java.util.LinkedList<Score> saveScore, int level) throws java.io.IOException
      This method is used to save the highscore from the linked lists into a text file to maintain a permanent highscore list.
      Parameters:
      saveScore - The linked list where the highscore list to be saved is.
      level - This is the level for which the highscore list is to be saved.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - This IOException is thrown if the highscore list does not exist.

    • Renumber

      private void Renumber​(java.util.LinkedList<Score> holdScore)
      This method is called to renumber the linked list after resorting it. The new rankings will be in ascending order in increments of 1 starting from 1.
      Parameters:
      holdScore - The linked list which is to be renumbered.

    • Add

      private void Add​(java.util.LinkedList<Score> holdScore, int ranking, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String levelType, int time, int score)
      This method is called to add a new entry into the ranking list. The new entry contains the player ranking, name, level type, time and score. The new entry is added to the linked list and is then saved into the permanent highscore list in the text file.
      Parameters:
      holdScore - The linked list where the new entry is to be loaded into.
      ranking - The ranking of the new entry.
      name - The name of the new entry.
      levelType - The level type of the new entry.
      time - The time of the new entry.
      score - The score of the new entry.

    • setLocation

      private void setLocation()
      This method is used to center the ScoreBoard by using the JFrame location.

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      This method is used to set the ScoreBoard title and to add in window listeners.

    • getRanking

      private int getRanking​(int level)
      This method gets the expected ranking of the player based on his score and time. The method looks for the first entry where the player score is larger than the old entry score. Then, it checks the time to see if the player time is less than the old entry time. If not, the method looks at the next entry and compares again. This means that for equal scores, the old scores rank higher as the record is made earlier. For equal scores and time, the old scores and time are ranked higher for the same reason.
      Parameters:
      level - This is the level of highscore list for which the new entry is compared to.
      Returns:
      This method returns an integer as the expected ranking of the player.

    • RemoveDuplicates

      private void RemoveDuplicates​(java.util.LinkedList<Score> holdScore)
      This method removes any duplicate entries in the rankings. The method checks for the same player name, score and level type and leaves only a single entry. Since this method is called after the rankings are resorted, only the best scores and best times for a person in each category is kept.
      Parameters:
      holdScore - The linked list where the duplicate entries are to be removed.

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      This action listener is called when the save button is pressed. If the name entered is invalid, the JLabel will ask for a valid username. If entered name is valid, the JButton is disabled and the new entry is saved into the linked list.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
      Parameters:
      e - This parameter is used to track the JButton save.
